summary:
## The Appalachian Mountains

The Appalachian Mountains, or Appalachians, are an old mountain range in eastern North America, running from Canada to Alabama. They are not as high as the Rocky Mountains, with the tallest peak, Mount Mitchell, reaching 6,684 feet.

These mountains formed over 1 billion years ago when continents collided, creating folded and faulted rocks. They've been shaped by erosion for millions of years.

The Appalachians were important during America's expansion, making east-west travel difficult. Today, they're known for the Appalachian Trail, a 2,175-mile hiking path.
title: Appalachian Mountains
